LexisNexis is an information
and analytics company

that provides solutions
to legal professionals

to help them win cases and
increase their business.

We looked at four different
use cases for our customers.
One was around how do we help them
with a conversational search

to find the information
that they're looking for.

Number two is around
summarizing that information
so that they can quickly get
to the answers that they're looking for.
The third is drafting,

the ability to draft an
initial draft of a memo,
an email to a client,
a brief that's going to be used in court.

It's not just pulling
snippets out of that document.

It's actually creating new
texts from that information.
And so that's a very powerful tool
that we get through these models.

And the fourth is around
analyzing documents.
So a customer can provide a document

and we can help analyze
that document, summarize it,

and allow them to ask
questions about the information
in the document that they provided.

If you think about the
information that we have,
it's ideal for large language models,
and that's where Bedrock comes in.
We were able to fine-tune our model
using a process called RLHF,

Reinforcement Learning
with Human Feedback.

Within Amazon Bedrock, we use
four different models today
because our solution is based
on a multi-model approach.

We select the best model
for the specific use case
that we have at the best price.
So the models that we're using today
include Claude V2 18K model.
We use the Claude V2 100K model.
We use the Claude Instant model,

and we also have our
fine-tuned Claude 18K model
that we're using for our solution.
And we made the decision to go
with an anthropic model within AWS
because we like the safety
that Anthropic provides with their model.
We have always trusted AWS
with our products in the past.
Been working with AWS since 2015,
so a lot of confidence in the security,

the privacy, the scalability
of the solutions.

If you think about over
the course of a year,
about 300,000 documents come out

and we would review about
20% of those manually
through these legal editing process.
We processed 300,000 summaries
in an automated way in about six weeks.
And so that's something

that we could not do
before that we can do now.

Our customers are so
enthusiastic about this
because they see the potential power
in these type of solutions,
the ability to make them more productive,

the ability to provide
high-quality work product
to their customers.
And so from our business perspective,
it's been a huge benefit for us.
